net.varkhan.base.containers.array
Class ByteArrays

java.lang.Object
  net.varkhan.base.containers.array.ByteArrays

public class ByteArrays
extends java.lang.Object

Static byte arrays manipulation utilities.

Utilities for manipulating arrays of bytes.

Method Detail

equals

public static boolean equals(byte[] array1,
                             byte[] array2)
Indicates whether two byte arrays are equal.

Parameters:
array1 - the first array
array2 - the second array
Returns:
true iff the arrays are either both null or have the same number of elements, and the values of elements in the same positions are equal

indexOf

public static int indexOf(byte item,
                          byte... array)
Returns the position of the first occurrence of a value inside an array.

Parameters:
item - the value to search for
array - the array to search
Returns:
-1 if item was not found in array, the position of the first element of the array equal to item

indexOf

public static int indexOf(byte[] array,
                          int pos,
                          byte[] sub)
Returns the position of the first occurrence of an array as a subsequence of an other array.

Parameters:
array - the array
pos - the starting point in the array
sub - the subsequence to find
Returns:
the smallest index idx greater than pos such that the elements of array starting at idx are exactly those of sub (-1 is returned if sub is not a subsequence of array)

searchInc

public static int searchInc(byte[] ary,
                            int inf,
                            int sup,
                            byte key)
Finds an object in a sorted array, in ascending order.

Parameters:
ary - the sorted array
inf - the minimum index
sup - the maximum index
key - the value to search for
Returns:
the key position in the array, or -(inspos+1), where inspos is the index of the first value in the array bigger than key

searchDec

public static int searchDec(byte[] ary,
                            int inf,
                            int sup,
                            byte key)
Finds an object in a sorted array, in descending order.

Parameters:
ary - the sorted array
inf - the minimum index
sup - the maximum index
key - the value to search for
Returns:
the key position in the array, or -(inspos+1), where inspos is the index of the first value in the array bigger than key

unionInc

public static byte[] unionInc(byte[] ary1,
                              int beg1,
                              int len1,
                              byte[] ary2,
                              int beg2,
                              int len2)
Computes the union of segments in two sorted arrays, in ascending order.

Parameters:
ary1 - the first sorted array
beg1 - the start position of the first segment
len1 - the length of the first segment
ary2 - the second sorted array
beg2 - the start position of the second segment
len2 - the length of the second segment
Returns:
the union of the two segments, with duplicates removed

unionDec

                              int beg1,
                              int len1,
                              byte[] ary2,
                              int beg2,
                              int len2)
Computes the union of segments in two sorted arrays, in descending order.

Parameters:
ary1 - the first sorted array
beg1 - the start position of the first segment
len1 - the length of the first segment
ary2 - the second sorted array
beg2 - the start position of the second segment
len2 - the length of the second segment
Returns:
the union of the two segments, with duplicates removed

ary2 - the second sorted array
beg2 - the start position of the second segment
len2 - the length of the second segment
Returns:
the intersection of the two segments, with duplicates removed

Parameters:

beg1 - the start position of the first segment
len1 - the length of the first segment
ary2 - the second sorted array
beg2 - the start position of the second segment
len2 - the length of the second segment
Returns:

append

public static byte[] append(byte[] array,
                            byte... elems)
Append elements to an array.

Parameters:
array - the array to append to
elems - the elements to append
Returns:
an array of bytes containing all the elements of array followed by all the elements in elems

prepend

public static byte[] prepend(byte[] array,
                             byte... elems)
Prepend elements to an array.

Parameters:
array - the array to prepend to
elems - the elements to prepend
Returns:
an array of bytes containing all the elements in elems followed by all the elements of array

concat

public static byte[] concat(byte[] array,
                            byte[]... arrays)
Concatenates several arrays.

Parameters:
array - the first array to append to
arrays - the arrays to append
Returns:
an array of bytes containing all the elements in the arrays, in order

lenVariadic

public static int lenVariadic(long val)
Returns the number of bytes used by a variadic integer

Parameters:
val - the value of the variadic integer
Returns:
the number of bytes required to encode this value in a byte array

getVariadic

public static long getVariadic(byte[] array,
                               int pos)
Decodes a variadic integer value from a byte array

Parameters:
array - the byte array
pos - the offset in the array
Returns:
the variadic value stored at offset pos

setVariadic

public static int setVariadic(byte[] array,
                              int pos,
                              long val)
Encodes a variadic integer value into a byte array

Parameters:
array - the byte array
pos - the offset in the array
val - the value to store at offset pos
Returns:
the number of bytes used to encode the value

subarray

public static byte[] subarray(byte[] array,
                              int beg,
                              int end)
Returns a segment of an array.

Parameters:
array - the source array
beg - the begining position of the segment, inclusive
end - the ending position of the segment, exclusive
Returns:
an array of bytes, of length end-beg, and containing all the elements between positions beg, inclusive, and end, exclusive, of the original array
